description: A fine-tooth hacksaw for controlled cuts where bolt cutters cannot reach

core:description.text: A hacksaw with a frame of bent iron and a blade that's been changed more times than anyone's counted. The teeth are fine and sharp, meant for the slow work that bolt cutters can't manageâ€”thicker bars at awkward angles, brackets welded into corners, anything that needs a clean cut rather than a violent one. The handle is wrapped in old leather that's gone dark with sweat and grime. It's patient work, using a hacksaw in the tunnels, but sometimes patience is what keeps a passage from collapsing when you force things.
